question.title: java.io.IOException: newPosition < 0: (-2048 < 0)
question.body:
I'm trying to insert data to a MS Access DB.

I'm using

insert = template.update("INSERT INTO tblE125Details (ForeasCode, EYear, ArProtokolou, InvNo, SName, Fname, DOB, sex, IDno, entipo, EKAANo,"
                    + "EKAAIssueDate, EKAAExpireDate, PaymentAmount, PaymentCurrency, HospFrom, HospTo, MedClaim, InDate)"
                    + " VALUES (?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?)","Test", 2025, "Test", "12345", "Smith", "John", "1980-01-01", "M", "ID123", "Type", "EKAA123", 
                   "2025-01-01", "2025-12-31", 100.50, "USD", "2025-01-01", "2025-12-31", "MedClaim123", "2025-01-01");

This is my datasource:

@Bean(name="db3")
   @ConfigurationProperties(prefix="database.third")
   public DataSource dataSourceE125export(){
      DriverManagerDataSource dataSource = new DriverManagerDataSource();
      dataSource.setDriverClassName("net.ucanaccess.jdbc.UcanaccessDriver");
                dataSource.setUrl("jdbc:ucanaccess://C:/Dropbox/Projects/DB2.MDB;openExlcusive=false;ignorecase=trueB");
      
  
      dataSource.setUsername("user");
      dataSource.setPassword("pass");
      return dataSource;
   }
   
   @Bean(name = "jdbcImportE125")
   public JdbcTemplate jdbcTemplate3(@Qualifier("db3") DataSource ds) {
    return new JdbcTemplate(ds);
   }

However, I'm getting the following error:

question_comments.body: Also review stackoverflow.com/questions/762438/… and stackoverflow.com/questions/14375586/…
Also, Access will not like hyphens in date structure. Again assuming date/time type field.
Access expects # delimiter for date/time type field data. Why do you have ? parameter placeholders followed by literal data?

This question is similar to: Insert data to ms access from java. If you believe it’s different, please edit the question, make it clear how it’s different and/or how the answers on that question are not helpful for your problem.
